stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: AI-Powered Browser Extensions Expose Code to Malicious Actors in China
stories.summary: MaliciousCorgi, a newly discovered threat, compromises popular AI extensions, sending sensitive code to servers in China. Users' intellectual property and security are at risk.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrent Computation: The Actors Model Revisited
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actors model, a groundbreaking framework for concurrent computation that remains influential in modern AI and distributed systems. The model provides a fundamental approach to managing complex, parallel processes.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Shifts Strategy, Embracing Claude Code Amidst GitHub Copilot Dominance
stories.summary: Microsoft is internally rolling out Anthropic's Claude Code across major engineering teams, encouraging even non-technical employees to leverage the AI coding tool, signaling a strategic shift towards a multi-tool AI approach.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Power of Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach to Scaling
stories.summary: Researchers are making strides in understanding the intricacies of agent systems, shedding light on when and why these systems succeed or fail. This breakthrough could pave the way for more effective and reliable AI applications.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Develop High-Performance Zero-Allocation Web Server Using OxCaml
stories.summary: A new web server built with OxCaml achieves remarkable speed while minimizing memory allocation, showcasing the potential for efficient language designs in high-performance applications.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source AI Research Tool Claims Superiority Over Google's Proprietary Technology
stories.summary: A developer's open-source deep research tool, Lutum Veritas, is challenging industry giants with its impressive performance, sparking interest in the potential of community-driven AI innovation.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Seeks Applied Researcher to Drive AI Innovation
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is looking for an applied researcher to join its team and advance its machine learning capabilities. The role promises opportunities to shape the future of AI research and development.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Scientists Uncover Key Shift in Aging Muscle Stem Cells' Priorities
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that muscle stem cells in older individuals undergo a significant change in focus, prioritizing long-term survival over rapid repair, which could have implications for aging and regenerative medicine. This fundamental shift in cellular behavior may contribute to the decline in muscle function that occurs with age.

stories.original_title: Apple's MacBook Pro DFU port documentation is wrong
stories.generated_headline: Apple's MacBook Pro DFU Port Documentation Sparks Frustration Among Users
stories.summary: Apple's documentation for identifying the DFU port on MacBook Pro models with Apple silicon is incorrect, causing issues with firmware updates and macOS installations. The mistake has led to confusion and wasted time for developers and users attempting to update their devices.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Breaking Down Nano-vLLM: The Powerhouse Behind Efficient AI Inference
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM is revolutionizing AI inference with its vLLM-style engine, unlocking faster and more efficient processing capabilities. This innovation is set to transform the future of AI applications.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLM Output Quality
stories.summary: A user's experience with running MLX LLMs on their iPhone 16 Pro Max resulted in subpar output, raising questions about device compatibility and optimization.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation with Minimal Code
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, achieves Apple container isolation and showcases innovative robotics capabilities, setting a new standard for compact and efficient robotic systems.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Users Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, research reveals a stark contrast between 'explorers' and 'implementers', highlighting fundamental differences in their approaches, priorities, and expectations from artificial intelligence.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Cracking the Code: Researchers Achieve 100% Accuracy in Wordle Puzzle Reconstruction from Shared Scores
stories.summary: Researchers have developed a method to perfectly reconstruct Wordle puzzles from shared scoreboards, raising questions about the security of online puzzle games. This breakthrough demonstrates the potential vulnerabilities of relying on seemingly innocuous scorekeeping systems.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Groundbreaking Study
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise can result in a younger-looking brain, potentially shedding light on the cognitive benefits of physical activity.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reins in AI Features in Windows 11 Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-driven features in Windows 11, including removing the generative AI-powered "Create" button in the Photos app, following criticism from users.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: AI Investment Trends: Are We Pulling the Plug Too Soon?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities approach a projected 6x increase, industry experts question whether current spending trends are prematurely plateauing, potentially stalling breakthroughs.
